item.title: fitch cuts japan credit rating outlook to negative
item.description: ratings agency fitch on friday cut its outlook on japan's sovereign debt, warning that the vast cost of a march earthquake and tsunami and the still-unknown bill for the clean-up after the nuclear disaster would further strain the country's already shaky public finances.

item.title: theater review | westchester: renovating a home and a father-son relationship
item.description: andrew gerle's play, based on john marchese's memoir, tells of how a very different father and son work together to renovate a home.

item.title: what did fans think of charlie sheen?
item.description: after charlie sheen's opening show in detroit on saturday, we asked fans what they thought, and then, pouf!, charlie appeared onstage.

item.title: way of the world: analyzing the u.s. like a business
item.description: in a new powerpoint presentation, mary meeker examines u.s. finances as if the country were a business, then asks what a turnaround expert would do to put usa inc. back in the black.

item.title: tens of thousands of libyans may be on move: u.n.
item.description: fighting in eastern libya may have displaced tens of thousands of people and severely disrupted basic services and food supply lines, the united nations said on wednesday.

item.title: russian spy agency complains about gmail, skype
item.description: russia's domestic security service called for access to encrypted communication providers like gmail, hotmail and skype on friday, saying the uncontrolled use of such services could threaten national security.

item.description: the knicks began a decade-long tailspin by losing a first-round best-of-five series to the toronto raptors led by vince carter.

item.description: researchers in massachusetts say they are on track to spot a record number of endangered right whales in cape cod bay and nearby waters.

item.description: "the who" frontman roger daltrey is taking the british band's 1969 rock opera "tommy" on a six-week north american tour beginning in september, concert promoters said on thursday.

item.title: senator took remedial flying instruction after landing on closed runway

item.title: california economy "on mend," governor wants tax hikes

item.description: incessant rains have turned indiana farmer larry winger's grain fields into ponds, making it impossible for him to seed his corn crop.

item.title: injured man rescued near summit of alaska's mount mckinley
item.description: a climber with a broken leg was rescued from a snowy spot 800 feet below the summit of mount mckinley, while one of his expedition partners was found dead farther down the mountain, the national park service said on friday.

item.description: butler's matt howard is a low-maintenance kind of guy who just happened to score the winning basket in the waning seconds against old dominion on thursday.
